hints.content: Start by understanding the structure of the input. You have a tree represented by a list of roads, where each road connects two cities. Remember that a tree with n nodes has exactly n-1 edges.
Consider how to traverse the tree. Depth-first search (DFS) or breadth-first search (BFS) can be useful to explore the cities and calculate the number of representatives in each subtree.
Each city has one representative. Think about how you can count the number of representatives that need to travel to the capital from each city.
Keep in mind the seating capacity of the cars. If a car can only hold 'seats' number of representatives, you need to calculate how many trips are required for the representatives from each city.
When calculating the fuel cost, remember that each trip to the capital costs 1 liter of fuel. If a car can take multiple representatives, you can minimize the number of trips.
As you traverse the tree, maintain a count of representatives for each city. For each city, calculate how many full cars are needed to transport all representatives to the capital.
Think about how to aggregate the fuel costs from each city back to the capital. The fuel cost from a city will be the number of trips multiplied by the distance to the capital.
Consider edge cases, such as when there are no roads (i.e., only the capital city exists). In this case, the fuel cost should be zero.
You might want to use a recursive approach to calculate the number of representatives and the fuel cost for each subtree. This can help you manage the complexity of the tree structure.
Finally, ensure your function returns the total minimum fuel cost after aggregating the costs from all cities. Remember to handle large inputs efficiently, as n can be as large as 100,000.

questionNotes: The input roads represent a valid tree structure.
Each city has exactly one representative.
The number of seats in each car is limited, affecting how many representatives can travel together.
The capital city is always city 0.
If there are no roads, the output should be 0.
